Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Support .NET Framework 4.8.1 in the compatible framework view" (#9321) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi there,

Could you please add .NET Framework 4.8.1 to the compatible framework view? See the example:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2767027/205999717-d7ab07b1-4ca8-46c6-8c1f-0b33dce396fc.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y][Fastpass]Aria-Expanded not allowed on Div Role" (#9320) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/manage/upload

Path | #verify-package-block
-- | -- 
Path | #import-readme-block
Path | #submit-block

Fix the following:
ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-expanded="true"

According to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-expanded#:~:text=The%20aria-expanded%20indicates%20to%20assistive%20technology%20whether%20the,on%20the%20elements%20that%20own%20expandable%20grouping%20containers. it looks like we should be adding some additional attributes to this div to indicate that it controls certain child elements. https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Techniques/failures/F59 this seems like the most relevant failure.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y][Fastpass]Aria label not allowed on attribute" (#9319) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json Path | #paket-cli > .alert-warning[role="alert"][aria-live="assertive"] > b[display="none"][aria-label="warning"] -- | -- Fix the following: aria-label attribute cannot be used on a b with no valid role attribute. https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/name-role-value.html https://accessibilityinsights.io/info-examples/web/aria-allowed-attr

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Ensures aria-hidden elements do not contain focusable elements" (#9299) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1656379
Environment Details:
Application Name: NuGet Service
#URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/MySqlConnector
Windows version: Windows 10
ChromiumEdge Version: 105.0.1343.42 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Repro Steps:
Please do not close this bug. This bug should only be closed by TCS, C+AI Accessibility tester after verification of the fix
Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/MySqlConnector
Run the Accessibility insights for web 

Issue: 
Ensures aria-hidden elements do not contain focusable elements (aria-hidden-focus - https://accessibilityinsights.io/info-examples/web/aria-hidden-focus)

Target application: NuGet Gallery | MySqlConnector 2.1.13 - https://www.nuget.org/packages/MySqlConnector

Element path: .prefix-reserve-title

Snippet: <span class="prefix-reserve-title" aria-hidden="true">

How to fix:
Fix all of the following:
  Focusable content should have tabindex='-1' or be removed from the DOM

Environment: Microsoft Edge version 106.0.1370.52

Note:
This appears to show up on many pages. As such, fixing it in the template should suffice to address all instances of this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: Add support for the net7.0 TFMs on the Frameworks tab" (#9313) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

.NET 7 GA's in November (this month). Let's get `net7.0`, `net7.0-windows` etc showing on the Frameworks tab, as computed frameworks.

The asset framework (meaning a `net7.0` asset is in the package) shows up fine:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/202015994-767c888d-8621-40e9-b288-24111eeccd8c.png)

But the computed frameworks do not.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/202016132-9b3f7870-cfdd-45d1-9c82-07eeb322c216.png)


### The Elevator Pitch

Add `net7.0` and the corresponding OS-specific frameworks to the Frameworks tab.

According to @JonDouglas and [in the docs](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/frameworks#net-5-os-specific-tfms), the set of OS-specific frameworks is the same as `net6.0`.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y] Incorrect role attribute on breadcrumb headings" (#9310) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Issue: 
The breadcrumb heading `<h1>` tags on pages like the 'Report Package' page cannot have the role "list". These serve more as headings anyway, so no role attribute should be required.

https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json/13.0.2-beta2/ReportAbuse

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Flags elements whose role is none or presentation and which cause the role conflict resolution to trigger." (#9300) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1656375

Environment Details:
Application Name: NuGet Service
#URL: https://www.nuget.org/account/ForgotPassword
Windows version: Windows 10
ChromiumEdge Version: 105.0.1343.42 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Repro Steps:
Please do not close this bug. This bug should only be closed by TCS, C+AI Accessibility tester after verification of the fix
Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/account/ForgotPassword
Run the Accessibility insights for web 
Issue: 
Flags elements whose role is none or presentation and which cause the role conflict resolution to trigger. (presentation-role-conflict - https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.4/presentation-role-conflict?application=msftAI)

Target application: NuGet Gallery | Forgot Password - https://www.nuget.org/account/ForgotPassword

Element path: iframe[title="reCAPTCHA"]

Snippet: <iframe title="reCAPTCHA" src="https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api2/anchor?ar=1&k=6Lf4P10UAAAAAPp-L5yBSChLOGUdU4ci187t7JCv&co=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnVnZXQub3JnOjQ0Mw..&hl=en&v=vP4jQKq0YJFzU6e21-BGy3GP&size=invisible&cb=ioqna7bs53lh" width="256" height="60" role="presentation" name="a-le5htsccnaz0" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" sandbox="allow-forms allow-popups allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-top-navigation allow-modals allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox allow-storage-access-by-user-activation" tabindex="1">

Similar issue observed in following scenarios:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.Services.AppAuthentication/1.6.1/ReportAbuse

How to fix:
Fix all of the following:
  Element is not focusable.

Environment: Microsoft Edge version 106.0.1370.52

Notes:
This appears to complain about the fix we made for tab ordering with the recaptcha iFrame. We should discuss what the proper tab ordering is here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Ensures role attribute has an appropriate value for the element" (#9301) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1656381
Environment Details:
Application Name: NuGet Service
#URL: https://www.nuget.org/profiles/Blazor.Components
Windows version: Windows 10
ChromiumEdge Version: 105.0.1343.42 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Repro Steps:
Please do not close this bug. This bug should only be closed by TCS, C+AI Accessibility tester after verification of the fix
Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/profiles/Blazor.Components
Run the Accessibility insights for web 

Issue: 
Ensures role attribute has an appropriate value for the element (aria-allowed-role - https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.4/aria-allowed-role?application=msftAI)

Target application: NuGet Gallery | Blazor.Components - https://www.nuget.org/profiles/Blazor.Components

Element path: .package[role="listitem"]:nth-child(1)

Snippet: <article class="package" role="listitem">

How to fix:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role listitem is not allowed for given element

Environment: Microsoft Edge version 106.0.1370.52

Note:
This also shows up in many places, and should be fixed in all locations with a template fix. Fix should hopefully be as simple as updating to a different element that allows listitem role.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: Allow README URLs from flat.badgen.net" (#9307) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

_No response_

### The Elevator Pitch

badgen.net is already on the list of allowed domains, however their subdomain flat.badgen.net (that provides a different badges style) is not.

Can we have flat.badgen.net subdomain added as well, so projects can use the flat style of badges as well?

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet PM UI uses the new vulnerability resource to display vulnerabilities for transitive dependencies." (#12306) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "NuGet plug-in API fails when doing simultaneous restores" (#9292) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.5

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Execute parallel restores that require authentication or other plug-in
2. Restore some times fails with an error like:
```
Problem starting the plugin 'PATHTOPLUGIN'. The process cannot access the file '%LocalAppData%\NuGet\plugins-cache\2a163a4397322a32ccf62440e8b2c089004a49c0\9d08616bea28af0d943074cf5bb029f7a6ac7aaf.dat-new' because it is being used by another process.
```

I suspect that the plug-in caching mechanism does not currently support this kind of concurrency.

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/Plugins/PluginCacheEntry.cs

This was reported by an internal team that is doing restores in a very custom way.  We will probably just not use an auth plug-in for now to work around the issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Plugins cannot be located when assemblies are not located next to Visual Studio" (#8220) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used nuget.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.2

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Set the MSBuild property `RestoreTaskAssemblyFile` to the full path to a local copy of `nuget.exe`
```
<PropertyGroup>
  <RestoreTaskAssemblyFile>$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)build\nuget.exe</RestoreTaskAssemblyFile>
</PropertyGroup>
```

2. Use a feed that requires authentication

3. Restore packages

Plug-ins like the credential provider cannot be found.  I'm assuming this is because its looking next to itself which is not next to Visual Studio.  I think it should look for environment variables like `VSINSTALLDIR` so that the credential providers that come with Visual Studio can be found.  This logic could be added to [PluginDiscoveryUtility](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/Plugins/PluginDiscoveryUtility.cs).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.Client repo introduced Microsoft.Web.XDT prebuilts during .NET 7.0.200 source-build" (#12261) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

nuget.client commit 20be995d651808feb5cd48f30cb97197e497377c

### Worked before?

c0de924b0cfc8089f4ce1f35360cb9cddcd81138

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Build failure: https://github.com/dotnet/installer/pull/15018

Context: NuGet.Client is included in the .NET SDK. When building the SDK from source for Linux, we cannot download packages from the internet that we don't produce during our build. Microsoft.Web.XDT is consumed by NuGet.Client and also produced during a .NET build from source. We rely on using the property `MicrosoftWebXdtPackageVersion` to override the version used in this repo with the one we need at build-time. The change https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/20be995d651808feb5cd48f30cb97197e497377c resulted in using a hardcoded version of 3.0.0. Instead, we should use the version `MicrosoftWebXdtPackageVersion` if it exists, otherwise use version 3.0.0 (or whatever other version this repo might need).

We can work around this right now using a patch, but this will need to be fixed as it is a regression ever since NuGet.Client adopted central package version management.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
/tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/NuGet.PackageManagement.csproj : error NU1103: Unable to find a stable package Microsoft.Web.Xdt with version (>= 3.0.0) [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/NuGet.PackageManagement.csproj : error NU1103:   - Found 1 version(s) in source-built [ Nearest version: 7.0.0-preview.22423.2 ] [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/NuGet.PackageManagement.csproj : error NU1103:   - Found 1 version(s) in previously-source-built [ Nearest version: 7.0.0-preview.22423.2 ] [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/NuGet.PackageManagement.csproj : error NU1103:   - Found 0 version(s) in prebuilt [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/NuGet.PackageManagement.csproj : error NU1103:   - Found 0 version(s) in reference-packages [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.csproj : error NU1103: Unable to find a stable package Microsoft.Web.Xdt with version (>= 3.0.0) [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.csproj : error NU1103:   - Found 1 version(s) in source-built [ Nearest version: 7.0.0-preview.22423.2 ] [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.csproj : error NU1103:   - Found 1 version(s) in previously-source-built [ Nearest version: 7.0.0-preview.22423.2 ] [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.csproj : error NU1103:   - Found 0 version(s) in prebuilt [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
  /tarball/src/nuget-client/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.Build.Tasks.csproj : error NU1103:   - Found 0 version(s) in reference-packages [/tarball/src/nuget-client/build/restorehelper.targets]
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Copyright headers are missing/inconsistent in some .cs files" (#12305) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

N/A

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

Other

### Repro Steps & Context

While browsing the source code contained within this repository, I noticed that not all .cs files contained the copyright header that is used in the other files within this repository.

It is my understanding that once moved into the .NET Foundation, all files should contain a consistent copyright header, assigning copyright to the .NET Foundation.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
N/A
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet transitive pinning changes g.props import order, breaking the build" (#12278) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

17.4

### Worked before?

It works until transitive pinning is enabled

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Without transitive pinning, the SetupManifest.vsmanproj.nuget.g.props file contains:
```xml
  <ImportGroup Condition=" '$(ExcludeRestorePackageImports)' != 'true' ">
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\nerdbank.gitversioning\3.5.107\build\Nerdbank.GitVersioning.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\nerdbank.gitversioning\3.5.107\build\Nerdbank.GitVersioning.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudioeng.microbuild.core\1.0.0\build\Microsoft.VisualStudioEng.MicroBuild.Core.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudioeng.microbuild.core\1.0.0\build\Microsoft.VisualStudioEng.MicroBuild.Core.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.visualstudio\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.VisualStudio.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.visualstudio\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.VisualStudio.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.sourcelink.common\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.SourceLink.Common.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.sourcelink.common\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.SourceLink.Common.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.build.tasks.git\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Git.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.build.tasks.git\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Git.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.sourcelink.azurerepos.git\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.SourceLink.AzureRepos.Git.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.sourcelink.azurerepos.git\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.SourceLink.AzureRepos.Git.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.setuptooling\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.SetupTooling.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.setuptooling\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.SetupTooling.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.vsman\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.Vsman.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.vsman\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.Vsman.props')" />
  </ImportGroup>
```

After enabling transitive pinning, the order of imports changes:

```xml
  <ImportGroup Condition=" '$(ExcludeRestorePackageImports)' != 'true' ">
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\nerdbank.gitversioning\3.5.107\build\Nerdbank.GitVersioning.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\nerdbank.gitversioning\3.5.107\build\Nerdbank.GitVersioning.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudioeng.microbuild.core\1.0.0\build\Microsoft.VisualStudioEng.MicroBuild.Core.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudioeng.microbuild.core\1.0.0\build\Microsoft.VisualStudioEng.MicroBuild.Core.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.vsman\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.Vsman.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.vsman\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.Vsman.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.visualstudio\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.VisualStudio.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.visualstudio\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.VisualStudio.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.sourcelink.azurerepos.git\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.SourceLink.AzureRepos.Git.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.sourcelink.azurerepos.git\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.SourceLink.AzureRepos.Git.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.setuptooling\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.SetupTooling.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.setuptooling\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.SetupTooling.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.sourcelink.common\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.SourceLink.Common.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.sourcelink.common\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.SourceLink.Common.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.build.tasks.git\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Git.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.build.tasks.git\1.1.1\build\Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Git.props')" />
  </ImportGroup>
```

Note in particular how in the 'before' xml, these two imports were in this particular order:

```xml
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.setuptooling\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.SetupTooling.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.setuptooling\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.SetupTooling.props')" />
    <Import Project="$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.vsman\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.Vsman.props" Condition="Exists('$(NuGetPackageRoot)\microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.vsman\2.0.84\build\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Internal.MicroBuild.Vsman.props')" />
```

But after transitive pinning, these two imports are declared in reverse order.

The `microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.vsman` package has a nuget dependency on `microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.setuptooling`, and evidently thus far has enjoyed a stable import order where its dependency was always imported first. Turning on transitive pinning breaks this order invariant. A `microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.vsman.props` file itself makes use of msbuild properties defined by the `microsoft.visualstudio.internal.microbuild.setuptooling.props` file, so this breaks our build.

This blocks [Pull Request 438402](https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_git/VS-Platform/pullrequest/438402): Activate transitive package version pinning
This is also going to block several other repos from adopting this otherwise valuable feature.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Transition from Symantec timestamping service to DigiCert timestamping service" (#64) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Between October 4th, 2022 and October 24, 2022 we will transition from the deprecated Symantec timestamping service currently in use to the DigiCert timestamping service for both Microsoft author signing and NuGet.org repository signing NuGet packages for new package submissions only.

*  October 4th – October 24th:  Update NuGet.org repository signing to use http://timestamp.digicert.com. Although all environments (DEV, INT, and PROD) will be updated during this window, http://nuget.org (PROD) specifically will be updated only near the beginning and end of this window.
*  October 18th – 20th:  Update Microsoft author signing to use http://timestamp.digicert.com.
 
We expect a smooth and quiet transition; however, if you have questions or concerns, either contact support@nuget.org or post [here](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9259).
 
Please see [dotnet/core#7688](https://github.com/dotnet/core/issues/7688) and [Proposal to re-enable signed NuGet package verification](https://github.com/dotnet/designs/blob/main/accepted/2021/signed-package-verification/re-enable-signed-package-verification.md) for context.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Microsoft Security Advisory  CVE-2022-41032 | .NET Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability" (#65) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: # Microsoft Security Advisory CVE-2022-41032 | .NET Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability ## Executive summary Microsoft is releasing this security advisory to provide information about a vulnerability in .NET 7.0.0-rc, .NET 6.0, .NET Core 3.1, and NuGet (NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol). This advisory also provides guidance on what developers can do to update their applications to remove this vulnerability. A vulnerability exists in .NET 7.0.0-rc.1, .NET 6.0, .NET Core 3.1, and NuGet clients (NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol) where a malicious actor could cause a user to execute arbitrary code. ## Discussion Discussion for this issue can be found at https://github.com/nuget/home/issues. (TBD) ## Mitigation factors Microsoft has not identified any mitigating factors for this vulnerability. ## Affected software ### NuGet & NuGet Packages - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol 6.3.0 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol 6.2.1 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol 6.0.2 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol 5.11.2 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol 5.9.2 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol 5.7.2 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol 4.9.5 version or earlier. [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/security/advisories/) ### .NET SDK(s) - Any .NET 6.0 application running on .NET 6.0.9 or earlier. - Any .NET 3.1 application running on .NET Core 3.1.29 or earlier. ### How do I know if I am affected? If you have a NuGet package or .NET SDK with a version listed in [affected software](#affected-software), you're exposed to the vulnerability. ### How do I fix the issue? To fix the issue, please install the latest version of .NET 6.0 or .NET Core 3.1 and NuGet (NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Protocol versions). If you have installed one or more .NET SDKs through Visual Studio, Visual Studio will prompt you to update Visual Studio, which will also update your .NET SDKs. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.3.0 or lower, you should download and install 6.3.1 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.3.1/nuget.exe . - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.2.1 or lower, you should download and install 6.2.2 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.2.2/nuget.exe . - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.0.2 or lower, you should download and install 6.0.3 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.0.3/nuget.exe . - If you're using NuGet.exe 5.11.2 or lower, you should download and install 5.11.3 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v5.11.3/nuget.exe . - If you're using NuGet.exe 5.9.2 or lower, you should download and install 5.9.3 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v5.9.3/nuget.exe . - If you're using NuGet.exe 5.7.2 or lower, you should download and install 5.7.3 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v5.7.3/nuget.exe . - If you're using NuGet.exe 4.9.5 or lower, you should download and install 4.9.6 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v4.9.6/nuget.exe . You can get the version of NuGet.exe by running the `nuget` command. You should see an output like the following: ``` NuGet Version: 6.0.0.280 usage: NuGet [args] [options] Type 'NuGet help ' for help on a specific command. To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs: https://www.nuget.org/downloads ``` You can list the versions you have installed by running the `dotnet --info` command. You should see an output like the following: ``` .NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json): Version: 6.0.300 Commit: 8473146e7d Runtime Environment: OS Name: Windows OS Version: 10.0.18363 OS Platform: Windows RID: win10-x64 Base Path: C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.300\ Host (useful for support): Version: 6.0.5 Commit: 8473146e7d .NET Core SDKs installed: 6.0.300 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk] .NET Core runtimes installed: Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App] Microsoft.NETCore.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App] Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App] To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs: https://aka.ms/dotnet-download ``` If you're using .NET Core 6.0, you should download and install Runtime 6.0.10 or SDK 6.0.110 (for Visual Studio 2022 v17.0) or SDK 6.0.402 (for Visual Studio 2022 v17.3) from https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-core/6.0. If you're using .NET Core 3.1, you should download and install Runtime 3.1.30 or SDK 3.1.424 (for Visual Studio 2019 v16.9 or Visual Studio 2011 16.11 or Visual Studio 2022 17.0 or Visual Studio 2022 17.1) from https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-core/3.1 .NET 6.0 and .NET Core 3.1 updates are also available from Microsoft Update. To access this either type "Check for updates" in your Windows search, or open Settings, choose Update & Security and then click Check for Updates. Once you have installed the updated runtime or SDK, restart your apps for the update to take effect. Additionally, if you've deployed self-contained applications targeting any of the impacted versions, these applications are also vulnerable and must be recompiled and redeployed. ## Other Information ### Reporting Security Issues If you have found a potential security issue in .NET Core 3.1 or .NET 6.0, please email details to [secure@microsoft.com](secure@microsoft.com). Reports may qualify for the Microsoft .NET Core & .NET 5 Bounty. Details of the Microsoft .NET Bounty Program including terms and conditions are at [https://aka.ms/corebounty](https://aka.ms/corebounty). ### Support You can ask questions about this issue on GitHub in the .NET GitHub organization. The main repo is located at [https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client). The [Announcements repo](https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues) will contain this bulletin as an issue and will include a link to a discussion issue. You can ask questions in the linked discussion issue. ### Disclaimer The information provided in this advisory is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. Microsoft disclaims all warranties, either express or implied, including the warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall Microsoft Corporation or its suppliers be liable for any damages whatsoever including direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, loss of business profits or special damages, even if Microsoft Corporation or its suppliers have been advised of the possibility of such damages. Some states do not allow the exclusion or limitation of liability for consequential or incidental damages so the foregoing limitation may not apply. ### Acknowledgements [Edward Thomson](https://twitter.com/ethomson) ### External Links [CVE 2022-41032](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2022-41032) ### Revisions V1.0 (October 11, 2022): Advisory published. _Version 1.0_ _Last Updated 2022-10-11_
